_description: Configure your Excel files synchronization settings below
_reference_file_comment: Path to the Excel file containing the main timestamp reference
_reference_timestamp_column_comment: Name of the timestamp column in the reference file, or Excel column letter (e.g., 'A') if no header

reference_headers._comment: Optional: map existing headers, letters, or indices to new names for the reference file

_reference_headers_comment: Keys can be existing names, Excel letters (A, B, AA), or indices (0-based). Values are the desired column names.
_output_file_comment: Path where the synchronized Excel file will be saved
_tolerance_seconds_comment: Tolerance in seconds for timestamp matching (0 = exact match, >0 = allow difference)

headers._comment: Optional: per-file headers mapping (same rules as reference_headers)

data_files._sheet_name_comment: Use 0 for first sheet, 1 for second, or 'SheetName' for named sheet

_data_files_comment: List of Excel files to synchronize with the reference timestamps. Columns can be names or Excel letters (A, B, AA, ...)
_usage_instructions: 1. Replace file paths with your actual Excel file locations
2. Update column names to match your Excel files
3. Set appropriate tolerance_seconds for your data sampling rates
4. Choose duplicate_strategy based on how you want to handle duplicate timestamps
